snippet: The decision is a new legal threat to the health care law and gave congressional Republicans a victory in their claims of overreach by the White House.
abstract: Federal Judge Rosemary M Collyer issues ruling giving House the right to sue Obama administration in effort to stop distribution of $136 million in insurance company subsidies that Congressional Republicans say were never authorized; ruling deals significant legal threat to health care reform law; if decision withstands appeal, it will be the first time House has succeed in legal challenge to a sitting administration over its spending power.

byline.contributor: Adam Liptak and Robert Pear contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The decision is a new legal threat to the health care law and gave congressional Republicans a victory in their claims of overreach by the White House.

headline.main: Judge Rules House Can Sue Obama Administration on Health Care Spending
headline.print_headline: Judge Clears House to Sue Over Funding Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
